results.title: Radha and Krishna (TEFC)
results.creator_credit: Jehangir Bhownagary and Documentary Films of India
results.brief_description: Among India’s legends one of the most poetic is the story of Radha and Krishna. Artists through the centuries have used this legend and the film brings to life the allegory in a series of miniature paintings.

results.title: Racoons picnic
results.creator_credit: Crawley Films and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description: The adventures of two young raccoons during a daylight safari in search of food. Beatrice and Willie set off through the woods and on reaching a lake, discover lunches left by two boys swimming. The boys discover the scavengers, the scavengers discover the angry boys and scamper off back to the safety of the woods.

results.title: Rabbits
results.creator_credit: John Ralmen, Lou Lilly, Films/West and Focus Films
results.brief_description: This film examines without commentary the habits and behaviour of domestic rabbits. It includes scenes of new-born and young rabbits, feeding and play activities. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: Rabbit on the Moon
results.brief_description: The story of a young Italian girl growing up in the Australian suburbs of the 70s, confused by the conflicting values of her classmates and those of her Italian family. She wonders about her relatives in Italy, acts as her parents interpreter and battles with being called a wog at school. Feeling like an outsider, she seeks solace in her pet rabbit, until the rabbit meets an untimely end. Winner of several awards including the AFI”S best short fiction.

results.title: Rabbit destruction conserves the soil
results.brief_description: How the Rabbit Destruction Council has succeeded in virtually destroying the rabbit population throughout New Zealand with the help of modern methods of mass destruction, eg spreading poison by airplane and fumigating. How the fertitlity of the eroded land has been rebuilt. Why farmers should still pay constant attention to the rabbit.

results.title: Rabbit control. Part 3: working in groups
results.creator_credit: Barbara "Tess" Dullard, Ian Blythman and Victoria. Dept. of Conservation and Environment
results.brief_description: Part 3 of a program designed to control the rabbit populations and their adverse effects on farming. This episode narrated by Maurie Fields suggests a solution to the problem - working in groups. By forming a local “Rabbit Control Group” or “Land Care Group” farmers would be able to: 1-reduce their costs by having proper equipment and supplies available when needed, 2-have effective rabbit control on all properties, and 3-moral and motivation would be boosted via the social contact between all members of the community. The local C.F.and L. office would also assist with information for the natural regeneration of trees and grasses. Effective rabbit control would benefit the environment by ensuring the return of the natural wildlife and also increase agricultural productivity.

results.title: RAAF Record. Newsreel No. 12
results.creator_credit: Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine newsreel includes the following: 1. In response to a SEATO request for assistance in Thailand, the 79th Squadron RAAF was based in South-eastern Thailand. Hercules transports flew in all ground personnel and equipment so that the base could be in working order immediately for the Sabre Jets which are equipped with air missiles. 2. Freedom of the city of Wagga was given to members of the RAAF in impressive ceremonies at the air base and in the city of Wagga.

results.title: RAAF Record. Newsreel No. 08
results.creator_credit: L.H. Hicks, Stanley Brogden and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine newsreel includes the following: 1. RAAF’s Lockheed Hercules transport. 2. Supersonic “dart” is practice target for fighters. 3. “Sarah” (search and rescue and homing) is a new radio device for sea rescues. 4. The RAAF Antarctic flight visits the Soviet base.
